meanings.definition: counterguerillas: a military unit trained to operate in small groups behind enemy lines
meanings.sent1: The counterguerillas stealthily moved through the forest to ambush the enemy.
meanings.sent2: The counterguerillas received special training to navigate enemy territory undetected.
meanings.sent3: The counterguerillas decided to have a surprise party behind enemy lines.
meanings.sent4: The counterguerillas were like shadows, striking swiftly and disappearing just as fast.
meanings.sent5: The counterguerillas were the silent protectors of their country, unseen but always ready to defend.

meanings.definition: counterguerillas: the act of engaging in guerrilla warfare against an enemy force
meanings.sent1: The counterguerillas launched a surprise attack on the enemy camp.
meanings.sent2: The counterguerillas used guerrilla tactics to disrupt the enemy's supply lines.
meanings.sent3: The counterguerillas decided to have a paintball match against the enemy.
meanings.sent4: The counterguerillas fought with the cunning of a fox, outsmarting their foes at every turn.
meanings.sent5: The counterguerillas were like ghosts, appearing out of nowhere to strike fear into the enemy's hearts.

meanings.definition: counterguerillas: to fight against guerrilla forces in a military operation
meanings.sent1: The soldiers were ordered to counterguerilla the enemy forces hiding in the mountains.
meanings.sent2: The army counterguerillaed the guerrilla fighters with precision and determination.
meanings.sent3: The general decided to counterguerilla by challenging the guerrillas to a dance-off.
meanings.sent4: The troops counterguerillaed with the ferocity of a lion protecting its pride.
meanings.sent5: The commander's strategy was to counterguerilla swiftly and decisively, catching the enemy off guard.
